executable.title: Compute Armature Weight
executable.description: Compute weights of armature edges using heat diffusion. For an armature of n edges, a weight vector of length n is computed for each voxel, where the ith vector component represents the weight of the ith armature edge at that voxel. The output is a file series named {weight_i.mha}, where weight_i.mha represents the weights for armature edge i. An import detail of the algorithm: As a preprocessing step, the bone voxels (voxels with value >=209) are partitioned by their proximity to the armature edges. Skeleton voxels that belong to the partition for an armature edge i will be assigned weight 1, and these voxels will be used as the source of the heat diffusion process.
executable.contributor: Yuanxin Liu (Kitware), Julien Finet (Kitware), Johan Andruejol (Kitware)

image.name: SkinnedVolume
image.label: Input Skinned Volume Labelmap
image.description: The labelmap of the segmented volume according to the armature

directory.name: WeightDirectory
directory.label: Weight Output Directory
directory.description: The directory to contain the weight files.

integer.name: FirstEdge
integer.label: Start Edge
integer.description: The first armature egde(bone) to process. If you want to specify a continuous range of bones from which you want to generate weights, enter the lower bone index here.

integer.name: LastEdge
integer.description: The last armature egde(bone) to process. If you want to specify a continuous range of bones from which you want to generate weights, enter the higher bone index here. Special value -1 means the last bone.
integer.label: End edge

integer.name: SmoothingIteration
integer.label: Smoothing Iteration Number
integer.description: Number of smoothing iterations. This is only necessary because we restrict the solving to a local region

double.name: ScaleFactor
double.label: Computation Scale Factor
double.description: Scale factor applied to the input images to speed up the processing. It is highly encouraged to use a sparser spacing than the input image.

integer.name: Padding
integer.label: Padding
integer.description: How far (in voxel units) outside the body the weights region will be computed. A little padding is strongly advised to make sure every voxel of the input as an attributed weight.

boolean.name: UseEnvelopes
boolean.label: Use Armature Envelopes
boolean.description: Use the envelope radius of each armature bone segment or not.

boolean.name: Debug
boolean.label: Debug Mode
boolean.description: Print debug logs and dump intermediate images.

boolean.name: IsArmatureInRAS
boolean.label: Armature in RAS
boolean.description: Whether input armature is already in the RAS(Right, Anterior, Superior) coordinate system (true) or in LPS (Left, Posterior, Superior) coordinate system (false, default). If not, it will be internally transformed into RAS.

boolean.name: BinaryWeight
boolean.label: Use Binary Weight
boolean.description: Use binary weight. for Debugging only

boolean.name: RunSequential
boolean.label: Run Sequential
boolean.description: Runs the computation of each bone sequentially instead of multi-threaded.
